programme.title: Long Lost Family: What Happened Next
programme.desc: We revisit Cathie who was reunited with half-sister Ann, and John, who had longed to find his father Kenneth. Lastly we join Michael and Maureen to discover what its like to have to get to know each other all over again.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Jerry Coleby-Williams meets a champion hibiscus grower, Costa Georgiadis starts his backyard pool to pond conversion, Jane Edmanson shows us how to propagate indoor plants and we explore the wonderful world of fungi.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Melissa Mackay.

programme.title: The Piano UK
programme.desc: A chance to watch the full final concert from the Royal Festival Hall, featuring performances by Lang Lang, Mika and the four finalists. (Final)

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: The team join Naomi in Saint Barnabas when her best friends father is murdered at a wedding. Meanwhile, Marlon tries to prepare for his sergeant exams but is easily distracted.

programme.title: Long Lost Family: What Happened Next
programme.desc: We revisit Marion and James, a divorced couple, who were united in their search for their son. Our next story reveals that not every reunion runs smoothly. And Laura, who reunited with her father Andy and brother Nten.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Costa Georgiadis explores an urban farm giving city kids a country experience, Sophie Thomson and her girls do some crafty flower pressing and Millie Ross drops in on a small suburban garden bursting with plants and quails.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Melissa Mackay.

programme.title: The Forsytes
programme.desc: Disaster strikes at Forsyte and Co. as Soames puts an end to Irenes Parisian dreams. Louisa faces a shock eviction. Can Jolyon save the day?

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: In Yarraville, Victoria, a passive house builder starts a crusade to build the healthiest home in Australia on the site of an old pigeon club house! (Final)

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Mario Wonder Review and Noob Cops!
programme.desc: This week on GGSP, we head to the Flower Kingdom to review the brand-new Mario adventure, Super Mario Bros. Wonder! Plus, its the thrilling conclusion to the Noob Cops saga!

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Robot Robbery
programme.desc: On Science and Technology dress-up day, Patrick is upset when his robot costume is stolen by an unidentified mad professor.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: Gwen is delighted when Ron suggests they go for a walk together, but it quickly derails when Gwen is left to babysit and accidentally loses Mr Parkers baby! Meanwhile, Felicity discovers her love for running.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: An artificial intelligence takes over a tech company.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Blossoms fear of the dentists drill causes her to avoid it at all costs.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer is playing the piano and torturing everyone with his musical inability! When the Flock discover that Bitzer is a virtuoso they decide its time for a party. They devise a plan to borrow the piano from the Farmer.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors take a dip in the sea to reveal how your sensory neurons detect when something is hot or cold, and they find themselves getting stuck in the mud when they join Her Majestys Coastguard in Operation Takeover.

programme.title: The Wonderful World Of Puppies
programme.desc: Some very special puppies enter a new phase of their lives - as they leave their littermates and join their new human families. Watch as they form bonds that last a lifetime and become mans best friend!

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Detective Pikachu Returns and Spawn Squad!
programme.desc: This week on GGSP, we investigate how many rubber chickens Detective Pikachu Returns deserves, plus Mollie and Reggie from Gardening Australia Junior join the Spawn Squad, and Granny Gem gives some sage advice!

programme.title: rage FIFTY 2025: Best Of The Rest Special
programme.desc: Everyones a winner on rage with the best videos that didnt quite crack the 2025 rage FIFTY.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Exciting Excursion
programme.desc: The Grade Five rock climbing excursion is jeopardised when the permission slips go missing, but Maudie suspects they may have been hidden on purpose.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.desc: Bill Nye helps a trapped Neil Degrasse Tyson.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Bubbles adopts a baby monster in the park.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer wants a family photo and instructs Bitzer to gather all the animals together. Getting them all to stand still at the same time is more than they can manage and Shaun discovers hes cut out of the shot!

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.sub-title: The Search for the Missing Dunnels
programme.desc: Lys sets out to retrieve escaped creatures.

programme.title: Documentary Now!
programme.desc: A profile of life at the top of the Professional Bowling League during the 2003 tournament season.

programme.title: Adam Hills: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker take an entertaining, off-beat look at the weeks big stories and answer your #IsItOk questions. With special guests Lorraine Kelly and Miles Jupp.

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: Talented and hungry dancers show up for the challenge which may shake up The Next Step.

programme.title: Moominvalley
programme.desc: The Moomin familys attempts to help a very shy girl only make things worse. Can Moomintroll learn to listen long enough to understand what she really needs?

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The sheep discover a set of bagpipes on the rubbish dump, which they immediately misidentify as a sick emu. They set about trying to nurse it back to health before releasing it back into the wild.

programme.title: Total Drama Island
programme.desc: With just 5 campers remaining things are getting tense. So today is just about having fun taking selfies with wild animals. Everyone had their rabies shot?

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: The Bears meet three cool tiger brothers. Grizz wants to be just like the oldest Tiger, TK, but he may not be the best role model

programme.title: Steven Universe
programme.desc: Steven and Connie try to ride Lion to the movie theatre, but Lion has other ideas.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Adam and Jamie turn dirigible detectives to try and solve one of aeronautics biggest puzzles. Plus Kari, Tory and Grant come face-to-face, and have to flee from some of Natures natural-born killers.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Laura Dayachandra wants to downsize but despite having dozens of buyers through, she cant seal the deal. There are rooms in disrepair and the dining room doesnt exist - but Phils convinced they can turn the house around.

programme.title: Hard Quiz Battle of the Networks
programme.desc: Its the Battle of the Networks as TV titans Larry Emdur, Leigh Sales, Angela Bishop and Karl Stefanovic step up to the podiums to defend their home channels honour. Will Tom out-host them all? Its must-see TV!

programme.title: Rage Charts
programme.desc: Count down the hottest chart hits and catch up on some of the most promising new popular music videos on rage.

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Collection
programme.desc: Mother is the perfect foil for the madness in Knightsbridge that so often takes over the house. Entertainer June Whitfield does this role proud. You can bet that your favourite Mother sketch will be in this episode. (Final)

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: Auditions continue, and a new A-troupe is formed, ending the journey to nationals for some and creating a new beginning for others.

programme.title: Moominvalley
programme.desc: Moomintroll faces his toughest challenge yet when he wakes up too early from hibernation. To survive the perils of deepest winter, he must first find his primal side with the help of a strange, ancient ancestor. (Final)

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Timmy accidentally eats a tomato grown with Miracle-Grow fertiliser and expands to become the King Kong of sheep. Shaun must keep the giant toddler out of sight while trying to figure out how to return him to normal size.

programme.title: Total Drama Island
programme.desc: The final 4 get must wander through a dark and spooky cave hunting for coins. The challenge only gets worse when they discover that something is also hunting them.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: While exploring a lantern festival, the Bears encounter Pandas long-lost family.

programme.title: Steven Universe
programme.desc: Stevens desire for some alone time unlocks a new room in the Temple that answers his every wish.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Its not often you find a house with carpet on the walls - but this is what Phil discovers in York. Steve and Jacqui Shipleys bungalow has been on the market for almost a year but Phils determined to help them sell.

programme.title: Semi-pro
programme.desc: In 1970s Michigan, the age of big hair and short shorts, one man goes all the way in his search for glory and redemption.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Nashs Jedi friends help reunite her favourite band.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: After seeing a toy Elf rocket, the King orders a real rocket to fly to the moon. Elf honour is at stake and the Elves make a rocket in record time. For the trip, Nanny packs a picnic.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos see an artist drawing a dog and decide to open and close the door to let the dog in and out of the room.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Katerina bakes mozies with Jodi, but rushes and forgets to add the oats. They slow down and make yummy mozies.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family have been on a trip to a mountain beauty spot. When Daddy Pig loses the car keys down a drain Mr Bull offers to find them with his digger...

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Its a perfect, windy day and Jonathan wishes to play kite with his dad. Mr Brown is stuck at home doing business, so Paddington takes Jonathan to the park to play kites.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Springtime in the Little Kingdom brings out tulips, daffodils, hedgehogs...and two very hungry gnomes. Nanny Plum and the Wise Old Elf come up with a plan to stop the gnomes from eating everything in sight.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and friends along with Mummy sheep and Granny Sheep are taking Vanessa to Grampy Rabbits boat yard to be inspired. The children make all sorts of creations from things lying around!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Its the day of the big Kangaroo Beach beach cricket match, but when Gemma and the cadets find a nest of turtle eggs, they play parents, vowing to protect the eggs from seagulls, crabs and flying cricket balls.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosima and Big Lizards solar-powered hoverboards run out of battery as night falls. Some troublesome glowbugs are attracted to Big Lizards dinner and manage to save the day!

programme.title: Play School
programme.desc: Hunter and Kaeng make delicious damper to eat as they sing around the campfire with special guest Gregg Dreise. We visit a festival celebrating NAIDOC week and Through The Windows, we watch a fun game of footy!

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: Pockets has a wonderful dream but soon after she wakes, shes forgotten it. Will the Mixmups find "another way" to catch a dream and keep it forever?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Pando discover a new climbing frame at the playground. Its got climbing bits, tippy bits and even wobbly bridge. But when Bing gets to the top of the slide its too scary for him to go down.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bingo finds a toy turtle at the playground and wants to take him home, but Dad says its not the done thing.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: In South Africa Mister Maker creates a sensational shark picture, in Australia, we find out if he can make a marble creature and in the UK theres a great way of creating colourful works of art from pieces of fruit.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: Thomas and Diesel get stuck in a snowstorm while making important deliveries and have to improvise train versions of winter sports to escape the blizzard and make it to Sodors Winter Games.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Today at playgroup Peppa and her friends make their own instruments from bits and bobs of old packaging.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: When a young Watermelonsuchus gets beached during a heatwave, Ginger and the Baby Pea Rexes have to get creative to work out a way to get the giant baby into the water.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Tish is struggling to eat with a wobbly tooth. Tash suggests they shrink themselves down to check out the tooth in person.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: Upon learning about a Scott family tall tale about their twin ancestors daring adventures, Drew and Jonathan build a pirate ship, only to set sail through town and learn what it really means to be a "Pirate Scott".

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Great Algae Escape
programme.desc: Captain Barnacles and crew must catch a runaway Octopod, when its hijacked by a group of crustaceans trying to escape their algae-infested waters.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee has his Opposites Badge, and helps the squirrels understand that an opposite is something that is exactly different to another thing, by using lots of fun examples.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Professor Pickles attempts to create an EPIC historical walking trail, but he creates emergency of EPIC proportions instead!

programme.title: Play School: Make and Create
programme.desc: Rachael and Teo get creative making swirly whirly marbling patterns on paper and fabric. They create a paper puppet world, and Teo uses the marbled fabric to make a fun hat to twist and shake in!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Charlotte Sheep is babysitting her cousin Suzy Sheep and her best friend Peppa. Peppa and Suzy are excited at their sleepover and sit up in bed talking about what they will do when they are all grown up.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Big Lizard and Cosima undertake an exciting nighttime mission rehoming a friendly slug thats taken residence in Cosimas bedroom!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets host a do something new for you day on Kangaroo Beach in an effort to help support Pounce while he learns a tricky new skill.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Newton likes the PJ Masks... but also likes his solitude.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: When Egg, the cheeky little chick goes on the run again Duggee whistles to get him back. Hang on a minute Duggee, what was that noise? A whistle? The squirrels want to learn how to whistle.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertato is having a sleepover at Tato Tower for all his friends, even Evil Pea.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Nash and the young Jedi transport a princess.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The visitors land on the Moon and begin to explore. They meet some friendly aliens and have fun making Sandcastles and sharing their picnic. Nanny creates a Jelly flood but luckily the Aliens love to eat Jelly!

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos watch a man practising his tennis strokes using a machine to shoot the balls to him, which prompts them to learn more about speed.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Daniel is frustrated when Juan Carlos doesnt pretend the same way he does. Dad shows them they can pretend in different ways

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George pays a visit to Mr Foxs Shop after his favourite toy, Mr Dinosaur breaks. With all the additional features surely Dino Roar is a good replacement?

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington meets Mateos dog, Lucky. He tries to teach him tricks, but Lucky will not behave.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: When Captain Squid leaves his treasure map in the Little Kingdom, Redbeard leads Ben, Holly and Nanny Plum on a treasure hunt. The map says the treasure is deep under water and guarded by a mermaid and a golden sea monster!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Today, Mummy and Daddy big are going to antenatal class while Peppa and George go to sibling school. Together, they learn all about babies and how to be the best siblings!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: When the cadets are put in charge of running the lifeguard club all by themselves, it proves to be the toughest - and most rewarding - day of their lives.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Volcanic smoke blocks the three Proximan suns and cause Big Lizard to become worryingly cold. Cosimas on the case and comes up with a super-hot solution!

programme.title: Play School
programme.desc: Emma and Kaeng make a fantastic feast of cauliflower cake and tabouleh salad. We see a family celebrating Eid al-Fitr with more festive food and fireworks, and Through The Windows, were invited to a birthday party!

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: The Mixmups build a nature box and decide to try and find someone to live in their home. But when their new friend doesnt want to live in the box, can tey find another way to make it happy?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Coco and Charlie are playing at Bings house when Coco spots the measuring lines on the wall that show how Bing has grown. Flop measures Bing and hes bigger than last time.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Mums sister Brandy comes over for a visit, she brings the kids onesies as a present, which has an unexpected effect on Bingo!

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: Mister Maker travels the world and meets lots of Mini Makers along the way. In Australia, find out if he can make an egg-cellent egg diver and in Hong Kong, discover how to make some really handy art!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: Percy takes a game of super-heroes and villains too far and hurts his friends feelings and accidentally becomes Sodors best bad guy.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family take Goldie the Fish to Doctor Hamster for her check-up. Dr Hamster wishes she could exercise more, so Grampy Rabbit decides to build something to help.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Split chases a glowing Chillipede into the depths of the Spooky Forest and gets lost inside an overgrown tree-root maze, where the only way out is to follow the sounds of Ginger and the other Baby Pea-Rexes.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Pola has forgotten to buy the meat for the family barbecue so, to avoid the barbecue being postponed, Tish proposes they hunt for vegetables for the barbecue instead.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: The Dream Factory Crew converts the Cruiser into the ultimate treasure hunting machine to track down a very special treasure buried by Principal Pittman when he was a boy.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Snapping Shrimp
programme.desc: The Octonauts encounter a Snapping Shrimp, a small creature that uses its claws to make a big (and stunning) noise.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Tags feeling grumpy because he didnt eat his breakfast. Luckily Duggee has his Breakfast Badge, so he can make whatever the Squirrels would like to eat - as it turns out they all like very different things for breakfast!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Hannah turns the Pontypandy Ocean Parade into a race, an ocean rescue is required.

programme.title: Play School: Make and Create
programme.desc: Zindzi and Alex are decorating tucker boxes for the toys using bits and bobs from The Useful Box! Special guest Dave showcases his cake decorating skills, and we visit Humptys Sandwich Van for Build Your Own Sandwich Day!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Doctor Hamster comes to school to talk about butterflies. The children paint caterpillars, make butterfly wings and even dance the life cycle of a butterfly.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosima and Big Lizard find some fascinatingly slippery fruit but bringing it safely back to the ship is more challenging than they imagined!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Pounce role-plays as legendary lifeguard Super Roo. Meanwhile, Frizzy helps Wanda make a Big Thing.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: With the PJ Masks help, Newton learns that hes not just "brains"; he can also use his powers to stop Romeo.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Its a lovely day and the squirrels are outside playing the Shape game. When it starts to rain, the squirrels have to hurry to find each animal a dry place but working out which animal goes where is a question of shape.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea is causing chaos in the veggie aisle with a fan powered trolley filled with a stinky cheese.

programme.title: Long Lost Family: What Happened Next
programme.desc: We revisit Cathie who was reunited with half-sister Ann, and John, who had longed to find his father Kenneth. Lastly we join Michael and Maureen to discover what its like to have to get to know each other all over again.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Michael Tetlow brings you the days top stories including the latest following the Bondi Beach Terror Attack, the Treasurer delivers the midyear economic update plus Day 1 of the Third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Michael Tetlow brings you the days top stories including the latest following the Bondi Beach Terror Attack, the Treasurer delivers the midyear economic update plus Day 1 of the Third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

programme.title: Whitlam Dismissal: 50 Years
programme.desc: The dismissal of an elected Australian Government has only happened once. 50 years ago Sir John Kerr sensationally sacked PM Gough Whitlam. Greg Jennett looks at the legacy of the historic event and how it shaped democracy.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Girish Sawlani presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: Bridget Brennan and James Glenday bring you the days top stories and latest news. Emma Rebellato reports live from Bondi with updated details after Sundays terror attack, plus weather with Nate Byrne.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to tell you whats happening and why it matters. Ros Childs brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News Hour
programme.desc: Stay in the know with Australias trusted news source. From your neighbourhood, across the country and around the world, ABC News bring you the days top stories and latest news, all verified. Presented by Joe OBrien.
Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.desc: On the brink of death in India, Bharat Sundaresan turned to cricket, gathering millions of followers. But its now in Australia that the colourful commentator has found true acceptance.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: The home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the big stories from across Australia and around the globe. The ABCs network of reporters cover important stories and all the news you need. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. Weve got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Michael Tetlow.
Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: Expanse: Nowhere Man
programme.desc: In 1999 a young American dumped his bicycle and walked out into the Great Sandy Desert in remote northern Australia. Why did he go out in the wilderness alone? And how do you search for someone who doesnt want to be found?

programme.title: Deep Time: Australias Epic History
programme.desc: Solua Middleton takes you on a journey through some of this countrys ancient and epic past, exploring Indigenous Australias deep history with stories passed down through countless generations.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: As the day begins get all the facts you need to stay informed. James Glenday and Emma Rebellato bring you the latest news, overnight developments and the days top stories, joined by Nate Byrne with your weather forecast.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC News Hour
programme.desc: Stay in the know with Australias trusted news source. From your neighbourhood, across the country and around the world, ABC News bring you the days top stories and latest news, all verified. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: 7.30 Special
programme.desc: Some of 7.30s highlights from 2025: meet artist Thom Roberts, who paints the world as he sees it. Plus visit the US and the silicon valley pronatalists. Also Grammy Award winning pop star Lorde talks about her latest album.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats going on in our world. Manny Tsigas presents the latest global news from ABC News correspondents plus interviews with experts and guests. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: The home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the big stories from across Australia and around the globe. The ABCs network of reporters cover important stories and all the news you need. Presented by Manny Tsigas.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. Weve got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Craig Smart.
